intro: Pimpinella nikoensis var. koreana, commonly known as Korean cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
